msItem.title: Muntakhab al-Lubāb
Muntakhab-i lubb al-Lubāb
منتخب اللباب
msItem.note: In a note in Persian and one in English on the front flyleaf, recto, the MS is said to be the first volume of Khafi Khan's history and this has been accepted in the Library catalogues, but in the introduction (f1b) the author says he is beginning the second, which is correct. See Storey. Front flyleaf, recto: Presented to the Oriental Translation Come. by Sir A. Malet Bart Inside back cover, armorial bookplate of Sir Cha. Warre Malet. Part one of volume II, containing a brief account of the origin of the house of Timur and the history of the Indian Mughals to A.H. 1067 (A.D. 1656). See notes. Headings and punctuation in red.
msItem.incipit: Jahan jahan shukr u sipas afzun az qiyas padshahi-ra sazast

listBibl.bibl: For Sir Alexander Malet's gift see the Transactions for 1830, pp. xxxiv-xxxv.

bindingDesc.p: Red leather Oriental binding with stamped cartouches with green grounds and gilt drawn decoration. Doublures with designs in silver. The binding is similar to that of Codrington/Reade No. 103, with the same stamps although it is somewhat the larger.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
